arts.ttl: Daizen Maeda urges 'tired' Celtic to ditch Dortmund hangover and dominate in Dingwall
arts.sum: Maeda feels the fans are owed a performance in the Highlands after their Champions League capitulation

arts.ttl: Post Match Reaction: Inconsistent Dortmund Succumb to Union Berlin
arts.sum: On a good day, I think Borussia Dortmund can beat any team in the world. Julian Brandt looked like he was the only attacking player ready to play today.

arts.ttl: Union Berlin stun Dortmund thanks to Kevin Vogt's first goal in a decade
arts.sum: Union Berlin claimed a pleasing victory over Borussia Dortmund with goals from Kevin Vogt and Yorbe Vertessen enough to see off a fightback from the visitors, with Julian Ryerson netting against his former club. Yorbe Vertessen fires home Union Berlin's second goal against Borussia Dortmund - IMAGO/Sebastian Räppold/Matthias Koch

arts.ttl: Borussia Dortmund goal feat has Kevin Vogt the toast of Union Berlin
arts.sum: Yorbe Vertessen was also on target for Bo Svensson's men in the German capital on Matchday 6 but it was Vogt who wore the widest smile in Berlin after his first-half penalty paved the way for a 2-1 victory that kept Union perfect on home soil this season. The Alte Försterei rejoiced in the first goal in a decade for Bundesliga journeyman Kevin Vogt as The Irons enjoyed one more home win of 2024/25, with the mighty Borussia Dortmund felled in the capital once again.

arts.ttl: Kehl fumes after disappointing Dortmund defeat
arts.sum: It's safe to say that Sebastian Kehl was not happy after watching Borussia Dortmund slip to a 2-1 defeat at the hands of Union Berlin.

arts.ttl: MOTM Poll: Dortmund Fall at the Alten Försterei
arts.sum: It very much felt like Borussia Dortmund were missing the extra gear in attack in Berlin, which meant that some incidents of sloppy defending and a little bit of luck was enough for Union Berlin to take all three points. Might seem like an odd nomination, as Guirassy really didn’t have take or create any big chances.

arts.ttl: 15:30 Kickoffs: Union Berlin upset Dortmund, Leverkusen drop points against Kiel
arts.sum: Two eminently surprising results in the latest set of Bundesliga 15:30 kickoffs saw both Borussia Dortmund and defending champs Bayer 04 Leverkusen drop points against underdog opponents. Nuri Sahin's BVB headed to the capital city to take on the league's worst offense, 1. FC Union Berlin. Bo Svensson's FCU pulled off the shock 2-1 upset. Leverkusen, meanwhile, could only draw promoted Kiel. Freiburg and Wolfsburg were victorious in the other two concurrent kickoffs, picking up away wins against respective opponents VfL Bochum and SV Werder Bremen.

arts.ttl: Brendan Rodgers’ detailed Dortmund analysis doesn’t wash with Celtic fans as ‘great insight’ dismissed by punters
arts.sum: The Hoops boss spoke in his media brief ahead of facing Ross County as he looked back to key moments in Germany

arts.ttl: Bundesliga Match Thread: Borussia Dortmund Visit Union Berlin
arts.sum: Use those and don’t share any illegal streams in the comments. Streaming: ESPN+ (USA), Sky Go (UK)

arts.ttl: Power Rankings: The best teams in Europe
arts.sum: Real Madrid's shock defeat to LOSC Lille and Bayern Munich's equally shocking 1-0 defeat to Aston Villa grabbed most of the column space, while some was also saved for Juventus's dramatic win over RB Leipzig too. Borussia Dortmund earn a spot in the rankings this week thanks to their thumping 7-1 win over an in-form Celtic side in the Champions League in midweek.
